hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 110 in today's
episode I have a new word for you
pet peeve let's find out what it means
and how you can use it in your daily
conversation pet peeve there are certain
things that bother you alot when someone
does something and it puts you off it
means that it is your pet peeve
it is something particular that bugs you
every time
pet peeve basically means something that
irritates you a lot it is something that
annoys you or something that you simply
dislike the word peeve means annoyance
and a pet peeve is an annoyance thats
nurtured like a pet it is something that
someone can never stop complaining about
so when you have a pet peeve you have a
very favorite irritation to talk about
many pet peeves are related to social
convention and hygiene they may consist
of small behaviors that are not
important but for some reason these
behaviors are extremely irritating for
example when you see a person chewing
with open mouth you feel disgusted it
bothers you and puts you off this means
it is your pet peeve example 1 marks
fascination for his new tablet was his
girlfriend's pet peeve as she always
felt neglected
example - Ana regrets house parties as
cleaning a messy kitchen and doing the
dishes are her pet beads example 3
Lisa's latest pet peeve is her husband's
snoring as it leaves her with sleepless
nights example 4 Richard was embarrassed
when his boss told him my biggest pet
peeve is my employees coming in late to
work example 5 being a frequent traveler
Jesse's pet peeve is delayed trains as
it makes her Restless example 6
Amy's pet peeve is driving to work as
she can no longer deal with the heavy
road traffic example 7 Ryan's pet peeve
is working while eating but has no
option due to extreme work pressure
example 8 kevin has a pet peeve of
waking up early after a late night out
example nine listening to extremely loud
music is mrs. Anderson's pet peeve as
she eventually gets a headache that's
the end of today's episode what pet
peeves do you have and how do you deal
